creator: ramya.visnu@gmail.com
text:
* Protocol Used : https
* PreConditon: Server Requires Client Certificates 
* SSL Key Store properties are set in the bean shell preprocessor as below: 

   * System.setProperty("javax.net.ssl.keyStore","/Absolute path to the keystore/sample.jks");
   * System.setProperty("javax.net.ssl.keyStorePassword","password");


* While making a https request am getting the following error in the logs , 

* Errors in the log: 
2013/08/06 14:22:03 INFO  - jmeter.config.KeystoreConfig: Configuring Keystore with (preload:True, startIndex:0, endIndex:0) 
2013/08/06 14:22:03 INFO  - jmeter.util.SSLManager: JmeterKeyStore Location: /Absolute path to the keystore/sample.jks type JKS 
2013/08/06 14:22:03 INFO  - jmeter.util.SSLManager: KeyStore created OK 
2013/08/06 14:22:03 ERROR - jmeter.util.SSLManager: Problem loading keystore: Keystore was tampered with, or password was incorrect java.io.IOException: Keystore was tampered with, or password was incorrect
	at sun.security.provider.JavaKeyStore.engineLoad(JavaKeyStore.java:771)
	at sun.security.provider.JavaKeyStore$JKS.engineLoad(JavaKeyStore.java:38)
	at java.security.KeyStore.load(KeyStore.java:1185)
	at org.apache.jmeter.util.keystore.JmeterKeyStore.load(JmeterKeyStore.java:66)
	at org.apache.jmeter.util.SSLManager.getKeyStore(SSLManager.java:126)
	at org.apache.jmeter.util.SSLManager.configureKeystore(SSLManager.java:283)
	at org.apache.jmeter.config.KeystoreConfig.testStarted(KeystoreConfig.java:95)
	at org.apache.jmeter.config.KeystoreConfig.testStarted(KeystoreConfig.java:62)
	at org.apache.jmeter.engine.StandardJMeterEngine.notifyTestListenersOfStart(StandardJMeterEngine.java:209)
	at org.apache.jmeter.engine.StandardJMeterEngine.run(StandardJMeterEngine.java:325)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)
Caused by: java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException: Password verification failed
	at sun.security.provider.JavaKeyStore.engineLoad(JavaKeyStore.java:769)
	... 10 more


* I'm able to successfully load the keystore using the correct password in the normal command line or using java, It only fails in JMETER.. Why is this happening ? It is able to find the right keystore but unable to load it because it thinks the password is incorrect which is not right.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text: The properties need to be set at startup time.

creator: ramya.visnu@gmail.com
text: Thanks very much, I have set the keystore properties in the system.properties file and it seems to load it fine

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
OK.

In future, please subscribe to the JMeter User list and ask there for any such usage issues.

Bugzilla is not intended as a support forum.

creator: ramya.visnu@gmail.com
text: Sure Will do , Just got confused with the error message in the logs, since it was telling me about the wrong password  ...
